name: Tesla Machine
description: A mysterious device invented by Nikola Tesla, capable of duplicating objects, including living beings.

content.title: Overview
content.body: The Tesla Machine is a pivotal invention in the story of **The Prestige**, designed and built by Nikola Tesla for the magician Robert Angier. The device is capable of creating an exact duplicate of an object or person placed inside it.

content.title: Appearance
content.body: The machine is large and imposing, with a network of wires and coils. It features a central platform where items or people are placed and is surrounded by a cage-like structure to contain its energy.

content.title: Function
content.body: When activated, the Tesla Machine uses a massive electrical charge to duplicate an object or person placed within its field, creating a perfect copy at a safe distance from the original.

content.title: History
content.body: The Tesla Machine was commissioned by Robert Angier, a rival magician seeking to outperform his competitor, Alfred Borden, with a groundbreaking act called *The Real Transported Man*. Nikola Tesla, portrayed by David Bowie, constructed the device at his laboratory in Colorado Springs.

content.title: Story Significance
content.body: The Tesla Machine is central to the plot of **The Prestige** as it allows Robert Angier to perform his most spectacular trick, creating a real duplicate of himself each night of his show. This ultimately leads to a series of tragic events, including Angier's own demise.
